getattr.description: Return the value of the specified attribute (property or method)

body:
class Person:
	name = 'John'
	age = 36
	country = 'Norway'
x = getattr(Person, 'age')
print(x)

globals.description: Return the current global symbol table as a dictionary

hasattr.description: Return True if the specified object has the specified attribute (property/method)

body:

	name = 'John'
	age = 36
	country = 'Norway'
x = hasattr(Person, 'age')
print(x)

issubclass.description: Return True if a specified class is a subclass of a specified object

body:
class myAge:
	age = 36
class myObj(myAge):
	name = 'John'
	age = myAge

	x = issubclass(myObj, myAge)
print(x)

map.description: Return the specified iterator with the specified function applied to each item

body:
def myfunc(a, b):
	return a + b
x = map(myfunc, ('apple', 'banana', 'cherry'), ('orange', 'lemon', 'pineapple'))
print(x)

capitalize.description: Converts the first character to upper case

body:
txt = hello, and welcome to my world.
x = txt.capitalize()
print (x)

txt = '36 is my age.'
x = txt.capitalize()
print (x)

txt = 'Hello, And Welcome To My World!'

print(x)

string.count.description: Return the number of times a specified value occurs in a string

body:
txt = 'I love apples, apple are my favorite fruit'
x = txt.count('apple')
print(x)

txt = 'I love apples, apple are my favorite fruit'
x = txt.count('apple', 10, 24)
print(x)

encode.description: Return an encoded version of the string

body:
txt = 'My name is MEØW'
x = txt.encode()
print()

endswith.description: Return true if the string ends with the specified value

body:
txt = 'Hello, And Welcome To My World!'
x = txt.endswith('.')
print(x)

txt = 'Hello, And Welcome To My World!'
x = txt.endswith('my world.', 5, 11)
print(x)

expandtabs.description: Sets the tab size of the string

body:
txt = 'H	e	l	l	o'
x = txt.expandtabs(2)
print(x)

find.description: Searches the string for a specified value and Return the position of where it was found

body:
txt = 'Hello, welcome to my world.'
x = txt.find('welcome')
print(x)

txt = 'Hello, And Welcome To My World!'
x = txt.find('e')
print(x)

txt = 'Hello, And Welcome To My World!'
x = txt.find('e', 5, 10)
print(x)
txt = 'Hello, And Welcome To My World!'

txt = 'Hello, And Welcome To My World!'

print(x)

clear.description: Removes all the elements from the dictionary

copy.description: Return a copy of the dictionary

fromkeys.description: Return a dictionary with the specified keys and values

get.description: Return the value of the specified key

items.description: Return a list containing the a tuple for each key value pair

keys.description: Return a list containing the dictionary's keys

pop.description: Removes the element with the specified key

popitem.description: Removes the last inserted key-value pai

setdefault.description: Return the value of the specified key. If the key does not exist: insert the key, with the specified value

update.description: Updates the dictionary with the specified key-value pairs

values.description: Return a list of all the values in the dictionary

count.description: Return the number of times a specified value occurs in a tuple

index.description: Searches the tuple for a specified value and Return the position of where it was found

add.description: Adds an element to the set

clear.description: Removes all the elements from the set

copy.description: Return a copy of the set

difference.description: Return a set containing the difference between two or more sets

difference_update.description: Removes the items in this set that are also included in another, specified set

intersection.description: Return a set, that is the intersection of two other sets

intersection_update.description: Removes the items in this set that are not present in other, specified set(s)

isdisjoint.description: Return whether two sets have a intersection or not

issubset.description: Return whether another set contains this set or not

issuperset.description: Return whether this set contains another set or not

symmetric_difference.description: Return a set with the symmetric differences of two sets

symmetric_difference_update.description: inserts the symmetric differences from this set and another

union.description: Return a set containing the union of sets

update.description: Update the set with the union of this set and others
